content: the front edge of each fin at around round 11 between the pectoral and ventral fins sew each fin into place along its front edge and hide the yarn tails inside the body 1 2 3 the fish is now complete and should look something like the photo on the right add eyes and/or a mouth if you haven t already see page 12 11 mouth & eyes you can create the eyes and mouth any way you like to give the fish some character but the method i use for a simple embroidered face is below 1 thread a piece of embroidery cotton insert the needle underneath a gill and pull the thread through the hole in the centre of round 1 2 insert the needle below and just to the left of the hole and bring it out below and to the right of the hole pull the thread through to make a diagonal stitch 3 insert the needle through the centre hole again and bring it out where you would like the first eye to be pull the thread through to create a ^ -shaped mouth 4 insert the needle just below where the thread emerges and bring it out on the other side of the head where you d like the second eye to be continue stitching back and forth through the head until the eyes are as large as you want them insert the needle again and bring it out under the gill where you started tie the ends in a knot and hide them inside the body 1 2 3 4 to finish off the eye add a small highlight by making a stitch in white at the top of each eye if you ve used safety eyes or beads you could make a stitch above and below each eye in contrasting coloured yarn to create an eye ring i hope you enjoyed making this little fish pattern by thalia evans this pattern is intended for personal use to make random acts of crochet kindness please give credit where appropriate and do not reuse the photos in this document if you use bead or safety eyes the finished item will not be suitable for children under 3 due to small parts www woollytea carrd co 12
